#summary Get a user's feed

==Description==
  * *Authorization Level:* require_user


==Parameters==
<table cellpadding="2" style="background-color:#E0FFFF; border:1px solid #48D1CC; margin: 0px; width: 100%">
||*Required*||*Name*||*Type*||*Description*||
||required||jabberId||jid||Jabber ID of the user whose feed is being requested.||
||optional||filter||text||Options: {all, vmailSent, vmailRecv, callEvent, vmailPostPublic, vmailPostRecv}||
|| ||start||integer||Page number of the user feed from which to start the retrieval.||
|| ||count||integer||Items per page of the user feed which is being retrieved.||
</table>


==Error Codes==
<table cellpadding="2" style="background-color:#FFC0CB; border:1px solid #CD5C5C; margin: 0px;">
||*Code*||*Exception*||*Description*||
||401||UnauthorizedAccessException||You cannot access the feed of user {JABBERID}.||
</table>

==Notes==
  * It is possible to do multiple items in the filter. Simply choose the filter items you want, and then combine them in a comma-separated string. (e.g. filter="vmailRecv, vmailPostRecv")
